entry.title: Re: Maintenance Order Cost Capitalize To Asset
entry.content:
Hi,

Refer this documentation for the linkages of Maintenance Order types to Settlement Profiles in the standard system: Configuring Settlement Profiles for Maintenance Orders 

By default, looks to be that only WBS and CTR are setup as optional valid settlement receivers in the settlement profiles.

Note that there is a SSCUI named "Create Settlement Profile" where you can edit the default Settlement Profiles (or create and link new profiles)

Refer screenshot below where I have edited the YEAM04 settlement profile (that is linked to the YA02 Proactive Maintenance Order Type) to make the settlement to a Fixed Asset an optional receiver.

Theoretically that should allow you to settle the maintenance order costs to a Fixed Asset, but admittedly I have not done a full end to end test on my end. If you make the config changes in your system and test the capitalisation process, could you please let me know how it goes?

Regards,

Tim

entry.title: Re: Extracting SAP S/4HANA Data (Tables & CDS Views) to E...
entry.content:
The use of RFC modules from the Operational Data Provisioning (ODP) Data Replication API outside of the SAP environment was never intended or supported, as has been clearly documented from the outset. While some partner solutions may have utilized this option within their connectors, it is advisable for customers and implementation partners to verify compatibility and support directly with third-party providers such as Theobald.

Concurrently, if the Data Service Provisioning (DSP) does not fully meet the project requirements, an alternative worth exploring is leveraging SAP BW/4HANA with Open Hub technology. This approach can serve as an effective data distribution.

entry.title: Re: Last Indicator Value in Line Monitor POD within SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
@brunocechella 

The Last Indicator service is expected a string data type. Have you tried to post your value as string and not as integer ? 

Regards,

Marcel

entry.title: Re: PM Fleet objects - Equipment additional fields for ve...
entry.content:
If you need some additional information on top of what Chris has mentioned.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud does not have a specific equipment category for Fleet, with specific fleet views and functionality (such as the consumption of fuel etc).

Instead we have the standard 'M-Machines' equipment category, that can be adapted as Chris mentioned in order to make an equipment 'fleet specific'.

I have some commentary in a previous topic for this as well: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/fleet-management-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-for-asset-management-public-edition/qaq-p/12797430/comment-id/4170141/emcs_t/S2h8ZW1haWx8a3Vkb3N8TTJTUDZOVElRTEE1WlB8MTI3OTc0MzF8S1VET1N8aEs#M4170141

Regards, 

Tim

entry.title: Manage single Application in SAP Cloud Identity Service
entry.content:
Hey,

I was wondering if it is possible to make the user application access public (register Button) for just one single CAP + UI5 application. This application should be accessible outside of Build-Work-Zone for Customers.

Any help in this direction would be helpful.

entry.title: Re: Datasphere: Using Inherited Standard Variables in Der...
entry.content: Hi Dimitar, not possible. You cannot injest code for security reasons. That is why you can only pass the value. Means Model B will pass to Model A and Model A passes to Model-View. Alternative would be to remove the Model-View parameter (persist the view in case you have performance issues) and then work with derived variables in model B/A. Cheers, Martin

entry.title: Re: Refurbishment Process
entry.content: Hi, are we referring to internal or external refurbishment? As far as I am aware the refurbishment process is not supported in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition (yet). There is no equivalent of a PM04 work order to settle the costs of the order to a material. This is a topic that is on the roadmap explorer: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?q=internal%2520refurbishment&range=CURRENT-LAST#;INNO=2D24430EC2AE1FE08C8868C2CEFDEE3B

entry.title: Rise With the Phoenix: Your SAPUI5 Coding Journey Using the Demo Kit
entry.content:
The long, hot summer vacation days are coming to an end. September is just around the corner, and it will kick off the busiest period of the year for business.

You are sitting relaxed at your spacious desk, in your favorite chair, looking at your monitor, and getting ready to do what you love: Start coding.  Today, you have a new idea that you want to turn into reality, and you want to do this fast: Code with SAPUI5. Maybe you have an SAP Fiori project coming up in the pipeline, or maybe you want to enter the world of SAP enterprise application development.

So, where should you start learning about SAPUI5 coding? The answer is simple, although initially, your task might seem overwhelming because a quick search on the topic returns hundreds of results.

One of the top search results would most likely be https://ui5.sap.com/, which is indeed the number one, comprehensive resource for improving your SAPUI5 coding skills.

The SAPUI5 SDK, or the Demo Kit, is the one-stop shop for modern developers who want to build state-of-the-art enterprise-grade SAP applications.

Think of the Demo Kit as the comprehensive code playground and learning hub for everything related to SAPUI5. It is built and maintained by hundreds of professionals who have dedicated their careers to building one of the most extensive, secure, and robust web application frameworks.

So, to save valuable time, go to the Demo Kit now and start your coding journey:

1. You will find extensive documentation covering the essentials, developing and extending apps, developing controls, and a What’s New section for all the latest and greatest features and functional capabilities in the most recent version of SAPUI5.

2. The Get Started: Setup, Tutorials, and Demo Apps section includes the foundational, legendary Walkthrough Tutorial, which, according to many in the SAPUI5 world, is the best resource for starting your SAPUI5 journey. The tutorial is available for JavaScript and TypeScript.

3. The API Reference section contains extensive information about all classes, interfaces, namespaces, and functions available within the SAPUI5 framework.

4. Browse, run, and download the Control Samples.

5. In the Demo Apps section, run tests, оpen and download apps, and explore UI5 Concepts in real-life scenarios.

6. The Resources section features dozens of curated development tools, troubleshooting tools, and customization toolboxes, including:

  • Icon Explorer: The right icon conveys more than words. Browse SAP’s extensive collection of icons to find exactly what fits your app’s context and message. 
  • Accessibility Guide: Create apps that are inclusive by design. The Accessibility Guide offers best practices and hands-on examples, whether you're a developer, UX designer, or business user. 
  • Card Explorer: Learn how to use integration cards – widget-like components ideal for dashboards and overview pages. 

Ready? OK, sit tight in your chair, plug in the headset with your favorite concentration music, open the Demo Kit, start your coding journey with SAPUI5, and… rise like the phoenix.

One more thing: Please tell us what’s on your mind. In the top right corner of the Demo Kit, you will find a “Feedback” icon. You can share your thoughts with us and help improve the Demo Kit.

The Demo Kit is also available for OpenUI5.

Please be informed that SHD0 (Transaction Screen Variant) is used for governing the behavior of various fields and not for adding any new fields. Please explore Custom Fields and Logic App in case you if  you are in S4, in case of R3 check for Screen Exits.

entry.title: Employee history import issue for Both EC and Manual Import Scenario
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I need your opinion on an issue related employee history import. My template is a EC integrated Total Compensation template with option to do manual EH import. We are using a both EC and manual import approach for USA this year, where record 19 April to 31 dec are imported from employee central and record 01 Jan to 18 April are manually imported. For bonus calculation we are using option 'Fixed Effective Date in Employee central or User Data File (point-in-time calculation)' as client wants to use 31 Dec salary for basis calculation.

After importing from EC, when I did manual import for Jan to April period, I am getting warning message "Basis (and currency) will be imported from User Data File and not from Employee History import." If I ignore and import, then I see for those records Currency code is blank.

Why is this error and what is your suggestion to update the currency field.

@xavierlegarrec 

@Alekya_Akula 

Thank you.

entry.title: Why SAP BTP Is the Architect’s New Canvas
entry.content:
Introduction

In the evolving world of enterprise IT, solution architects need a development platform that balances agility with structural integrity and SAP BTP delivers just that. It’s not merely a technology stack but it's a canvas where business intent meets technical artistry.

1. BTP Through the Architect’s Lens

SAP BTP combines application development, data & analytics, integration, and AI/automation into one cohesive platform. For example, you can build a microservice in CAP that pushes real-time sales data to a dashboard in SAC using Integration Suite without touching the core S/4HANA code. This helps avoid messy customizations and keeps your architecture clean.

2. Why It Matters for the Business

Using BTP isn’t just about technology but it’s about delivering results faster. Your stakeholders get real-time insights, automated processes, and new capabilities without waiting months for custom S/4HANA changes. BTP helps you stay agile while keeping systems secure and compliant.

3. The Core Pillars You Should Master

As an architect, you should be comfortable with four main areas:

  • Development & Automation: Decide when to use CAP, RAP, or low-code tools like SAP Build Apps depending on business needs and governance.
  • Data & Analytics: Use SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere to converge enterprise-wide insights with ease.
  • Integration: Integration Suite delivers APIs, workflows, Event Mesh just plug the right adapter and connect systems seamlessly.
  • Intelligence & Automation: AI services and automation close the loop from predictive insights to autonomous decision-handling

4. Why Architects Should Focus Here

  • Clean Core Strategy: Push extensions into BTP, not into S/4HANA (SAP’s clean-core philosophy).
  • Future-Proof Integrations: Use API-led patterns and composable services to stay nimble.
  • One Platform, Many Scenarios: Your SAC, CAP apps, workflows, and APIs can all live on BTP. This streamlines operations and ensures governance.
  • Pattern Reusability: Build integrations and dashboards once, and reuse them across multiple scenarios.

5. A Real-World Glimpse

Consider a manufacturing enterprise needing real-time sales dashboards. Architecting on BTP means:

Real-Time Integration: Use Integration Suite to funnel S/4HANA data through Event Mesh.

Clean Extensions: Enrich sales logic using CAP-based microservices.

Visualization: Deliver dashboards via SAP Analytics Cloud.

Governance: All components live under a unified BTP administration umbrella.

No messy SAP wrappers, no brittle custom code, just elegant, maintainable architecture.

 

Conclusion

For today’s architect, SAP BTP is less of a toolset and more of a design philosophy, a way to tie business strategy, integration, data, and intelligence into one disciplined, scalable platform. It’s a way to work smarter as an architect. Master it once, and you’re not just configuring systems, but you are shaping the future of your company’s SAP landscape.

#SAPBTP
#SAPSolutionArchitect
#SAPIntegration
#SAPAnalyticsCloud
#CleanCore

entry.title: Re: Maintenance Order Cost Capitalize To Asset
entry.content: Yes, it’s possible, but not directly. only maintenance costs that qualify as capitalizable (like asset improvements) can be routed through investment measures and settled to an Asset Under Construction before becoming a fixed asset. Routine maintenance remains an expense.

entry.title: Re: From ECC to S/4HANA - Available ressources and trainings
entry.content:
Hi @Jonathan_Denis,

SAP changed some names in S/4HANA. PM is now part of Asset Management | SAP Help Portal.

On Learn SAP skills | SAP Learning you find some learning related to asset management:

  • Discovering SAP Enterprise Asset Management
  • Applying SAP S/4HANA Asset Management
  • Configuring SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Asset Management
  • Get Certified: SAP Certified Associate - SAP S/4HANA Asset Manage (Learning Hub Subscription required)

If you are using Customer Service (CS) then you should be aware that CS is part of the Compatibility Scope. Usage rights expire by the end of 2030. The successor is S/4HANA Service:

  • 2962632 - S4TWL - Customer Service - SAP for Me

General information about S/4HANA:

  • Key Functional Topics in a System Conversion to SAP S/4HANA
  • Mapping your journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition : A practical guide for senior IT leadership
  • SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Delta Scope
  • SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Delta Scope - SAP Community
  • The TOP Simplification List Items - SAP Community
  • Simplification Item Catalog - SAP for Me
  • 2269324 - Compatibility Scope Matrix for SAP S/4HANA - SAP for Me
  • SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library
  • How to analyze S/4HANA tables with proxy objects - SAP Community

entry.title: SAP public cloud restrictions
entry.content:
We are facing an issue with role management for our accounting profiles. Specifically, we aim to restrict access based on profit centers by excluding a particular set of profit centers, rather than including them. This method is critical because new profit centers are frequently added, and excluding specific ones is more efficient.
The current challenge lies in the restriction field, which only allows specifying values to be included. Our attempt to enter exclusions using the format !(=value) results in values being truncated and recorded incorrectly.
We seek guidance or a solution that would allow us to configure these restrictions in a more flexible manner, enabling exclusions and thereby streamlining access management for dynamically changing profit center configurations.

entry.title: What are the must-have features and biggest challenges in eWallet app development?
entry.content:
Hey everyone! 

I'm currently exploring the development of an eWallet app and would love to hear from others who have worked on similar projects—whether you're a developer, designer, product manager, or fintech enthusiast.

There are a lot of moving parts when it comes to eWallets: security, compliance, UI/UX, scalability, and third-party integrations, just to name a few. I’m curious to know:

What core features should absolutely be included in a modern eWallet app?

What security measures or best practices are essential to protect user data and transactions?

How do you handle KYC/AML compliance in your apps?

Any tips on choosing and integrating the right payment gateways or APIs?

What were your biggest technical or regulatory challenges, and how did you overcome them?

What mistakes would you avoid if you were to build one again?

Looking forward to your thoughts, lessons learned, and any tools or resources you'd recommend. 

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Give Your AI Agent Some Tools: Introducing the UI5 MCP Server
entry.content:
We are happy to announce the release of the UI5 MCP server – an open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI agents with comprehensive UI5 knowledge. By combining best-practice guidelines, project-aware context information, templates for creating new projects, and access to the rich set of UI5 CLI tools, the UI5 MCP server transforms AI agents into UI5 development experts. 

In parallel to this release, our colleagues from CAP and SAP Fiori elements have also introduced dedicated MCP servers: 

  • Boost your CAP Development with AI: Introducing the MCP Server for CAP
  • SAP Fiori Tools Update – First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI Workflows

 

Why Use the UI5 MCP Server? 

  • Large Language Models (LLMs) sometimes lack information on the latest best practices and APIs recommended for UI5 development. 
  • They might recommend the use of UI5 APIs that do not exist in the version used by your project, or of APIs that have been marked as deprecated. 
  • By facilitating UI5 linter, your coding agent can validate the changes it has made, ensuring they follow current best practices. 
  • Scaffolding can help agents kickstart new projects faster and with established patterns, saving token costs.

 

Setup 

Installing the UI5 MCP server is easy. Head over to the project page and follow the instructions for your code editor (your MCP client): https://github.com/UI5/mcp-server#setup. 

Some IDEs (like VS Code) allow you to add MCP servers directly from npm. In that case, choose this option and provide the package name "@ui5/mcp-server" as shown here: 

Once installed, the AI agent in your IDE will automatically gain access to the UI5 MCP server and can start using the tools at its own discretion. Depending on your IDE and settings, you may need to approve the first tool calls. 

 

Try It! 

The UI5 MCP server works well for everyday tasks in UI5 projects. It can help you refactor your code and add new features. 

In your UI5 projects, try out some prompts like the following: 

  • "Explain the difference between the sap.ui.require and sap.ui.define APIs" 
  • "Should I use sap.ui.table.Table or sap.m.List? What is the difference?" 
  • "How can I style an sap.m.Button to appear as a "reject" action?" 

Ask questions about your code: 

  • "Does this UI5 view apply best practices?" 
  • "Should I update the UI5 version of this project?" 
  • "Help me migrate any deprecated UI5 API usage in this UI5 controller" 

 

Tools 

This release of the UI5 MCP server includes the following six tools, which can be accessed by your AI agent: 

 

Best Practice Guidance for Your Agent: get_guidelines 

Provides curated UI5 development guidelines specifically formatted for AI consumption, ensuring that it follows fundamental concepts and that the generated code adheres to current best practices. 

 

Project Scaffolding: create_ui5_app 

Creates a foundation to start new UI5 projects. The tool comes with templates for both JavaScript and TypeScript UI5 applications. They can be generated as standalone apps or integrated into an existing CAP application.  

The templates feature pre-configured OData model setups and follow current best practices. 

 

Search the UI5 API Reference: get_api_reference 

Allows the AI agent to search the UI5 API reference and learn about API descriptions, signatures, and deprecation information. You may have encountered AI agents hallucinating about UI5 APIs that do not exist. This tool will effectively overcome such problems. 

The UI5 MCP server ensures that the version of the API reference matches with the UI5 version configured in your project, so you always get relevant information. 

 

Let the Agent Fix Your Code: run_ui5_linter 

This tool exposes functionality of UI5 linter, allowing the AI agent to scan a UI5 project for problems such as the use of deprecated UI5 APIs, and to apply any fixes provided by UI5 linter. 

Beyond these basic linting capabilities, the tool also provides rich contextual information, including rule descriptions, extracts of relevant API references, and even entire guides for the manual migration of certain deprecated APIs that can’t be fixed automatically by UI5 linter. These guides offer step-by-step instructions that guide the agent through complex refactoring, for example when replacing a deprecated, synchronous UI5 API with its modern, asynchronous successor. 

 

Project Insights: get_project_info 

Provides selected metadata for your UI5 project. This includes the relevant configuration, the framework version and libraries used, and current information regarding the version’s support status. All this allows the AI agents to quicky gain important insights about the project. 

 

UI5 Version Overview: get_version_info 

Delivers real-time information about UI5 framework versions, including the support status and upgrade paths. 

 

Dive Deeper 

If you’re interested in learning more about the inner workings of the UI5 MCP server, check out the code at github.com/UI5/mcp-server and read the architecture document. 

Don’t hesitate to reach out if you should run into any trouble using this new tool. Simply create an issue on GitHub, and we’ll be happy to help. You can also propose new features through this method. 

As always, we’re looking forward to your feedback!

entry.title: Re: ABAP Cloud Application Jobs: Overcoming Key Challenges

entry.title: Boost your CAP Development with AI: Introducing the MCP Server for CAP
entry.content:
Imagine the following: You are an experienced developer, working on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) projects. You use AI agents, such as Claude Code, opencode, or GitHub Copilot, to support you in your daily work. Wouldn't it be cool if the used LLM can help you develop CAP applications? With our new MCP server for CAP, we can provide more context about your project as well as relevant CAP examples to steer the LLM in doing the right thing.

 

What is an MCP Server?

An MCP (Model Context Protocol) server is designed to manage and deliver capabilities to Large Language Models (LLMs) via AI agents. It bridges the gap between LLMs and external resources such as services, tools, and data, enabling LLMs to interact with these resources. The newly introduced MCP server for CAP transforms AI agents into CAP development experts. It provides context-focused tools that aim to help the AI agent to answer questions such as:

  • Which CDS (Core Data Services) services does my project expose and where are they served?
  • What are the entities about and how do they relate to each other?
  • How do I add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js?
  • How can I register custom READ handlers in CAP Java?

 

The MCP Server for CAP

In the context of the assisted development introduced in the beginning, this means: You might ask the LLM to add, for example, a bound action `setToCompleted` to the entity `Orders`. Without our new MCP server for CAP, the LLM would hallucinate and could invent a new syntax and do a lot of file searches to find the relevant file. With the help of our new MCP server for CAP the LLM behaves as intended. To do so, the LLM generates a tool call to check the Orders entity and relevant information is returned, such as its elements and file location. It also generates a tool call to check the CAP documentation for bound actions. Based on the results, it generates the correct CDS code to add the bound action. This, of course, is just one example. We designed our MCP server for CAP to help you with arbitrary tasks instead of focusing on single commands.

For this purpose, our newly introduced MCP server for CAP provides the following two tools for AI-assisted development of CAP applications:

search_model

This tool allows the AI model to perform a fuzzy search for CDS definitions (entities, services, actions) within a unified compiled CDS model of all your .cds files. This CDS model includes the model structure and relationships, annotations and metadata, and the generated HTTP endpoints.

The fuzzy search algorithm matches definition names and supports partial matches, making it easy to find entities such as "Books" even when searching for "book".

search_docs

This tool enables the AI model to perform a semantic search through the preprocessed  CAP documentation, which is stored locally as embeddings. The search query is converted to an embedding vector. Finally, a similarity search is performed to find the relevant parts of the documentation, which have the highest semantic similarity to your query even if the exact keywords are not used.

Please note: These tools are meant to be used by AI models and do not constitute a stable API. But for experimental purposes, you can also use the tools directly from the command line as documented here: MCP server for AI-assisted development of CAP applications.

 

Try it out

Are you excited to try it out? Detailed instructions can be found here: MCP server for AI-assisted development of CAP applications.

Important: Our MCP Server for CAP is designed to support professional developers in their daily work. As with all AI-generated information, you should check the generated results carefully to avoid unintended side effects.

We are excited to announce that the MCP Server for CAP is an open-source project, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. Learn more about open source at SAP.

We are very curious to see what you will do with our MCP server for CAP! Please don't hesitate to provide your feedback here or report any issues in our GitHub repository.

 

Beyond CAP

We also offer a UI5 MCP server and an MCP server for SAP Fiori, ensuring that you have a comprehensive suite of tools to enhance your development workflow across various SAP technologies. You can find the packages here: UI5 MCP server and MCP server for SAP Fiori.

The introduction of the MCP servers for CAP, SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori marks a significant step forward in leveraging AI to enhance developer productivity.

Stay tuned for more updates. Happy coding!

entry.title: SAP Fiori Tools Update – First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI Workflows
entry.content:
We’re excited to announce the release of the SAP Fiori MCP server, a new capability that lets AI coding assistants directly create and edit SAP Fiori applications. This marks the next milestone in our AI journey, following the Project Accelerator introduced earlier this year.

What is MCP — and why it matters?

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that standardizes how applications provide context to large language models. MCP is already supported by clients such as Claude, Cline, Cursor, and VS Code allowing AI-powered workflows to interact seamlessly with developer tools.

Introducing the SAP Fiori MCP server

The SAP Fiori MCP server (@sap-ux/fiori-mcp-server) is an open-source node.js module delivered as part of the open-ux-tools repository. It enables developers using AI coding assistants to generate and adapt SAP Fiori elements applications with precision and context awareness.

It is not the only MCP server published by SAP. The CAP MCP server (@cap-js/mcp-server) provides tools to create and modify CAP node.js projects, and the UI5 MCP server (@ui5/mcp-server) allows AI assistants to write SAPUI5 code. Together, these servers provide complementary entry points into different areas of SAP application development, so that AI assistants can seamlessly data models, SAP Fiori applications, and SAPUI5 code.

For more information also have a look at the related blog posts:

  • Boost your CAP Development with AI: Introducing the MCP Server for CAP
  • Give Your AI Agent Some Tools: Introducing the UI5 MCP Server

With the MCP servers in place, you can already try out scenarios such as:

  • “Please add an SAP Fiori elements list report app to my CAP project.”
  • “Generate a new CAP project and SAP Fiori app based on my_sketch.png.”
  • “Add Flexible Column Layout to the app.”
  • “Enable initial load for the SAP Fiori app.”

⚠️ Note: The SAP Fiori MCP server is currently released in experimental state and subject to rapid change and enhancements.

AI assistants can discover and act on SAP Fiori projects

The first release comes with a set of capabilities designed to let AI assistants both discover and act on SAP Fiori projects. The SAP Fiori MCP server provides tools to generate SAP Fiori elements applications for CAP node.js projects, finds SAP Fiori applications in the workspace, and allows to edit applications and pages inside applications.

To ensure that the AI produces correct results, we propose rules that guide the LLM’s behavior (see rules). These rules cover important aspects such as using proper SAP Fiori elements application patterns, ensuring data models are valid with UUID primary keys, generating sample data consistently, and preferring code-based modifications over screen personalization.

You can configure the server to be directly called with npx or install it globally via npm (see usage). In both cases, it integrates easily into an MCP-enabled client such as Cline.

Example how the SAP Fiori MCP server is used in Cline.

Developers can build apps more quickly using MCP servers

By connecting directly into SAP Fiori projects through MCP, developers gain a much more cost-effective way to experiment with AI support. They can let LLMs execute complex tasks in context—while the built-in functions and rules ensure adherence to SAP Fiori best practices. This reduces the risk of hallucinations, accelerates prototyping, and makes it easier to iterate quickly on new ideas. Since the SAP Fiori MCP server is with other MCP servers like UI5 and CAP, developers can benefit from a consistent AI-driven experience across different parts of the development process.

This is the first step on the MCP journey

The current release is just the first step. We are already working on extending the server with a document search feature that will make guidance from SAP documentation, tutorials, and examples directly available to the LLM. This means that the AI assistant won’t just follow rules embedded in the server but can also draw from the wealth of published learning content.

In addition, the generator functionality, which in the first release is limited to CAP node.js projects, will be expanded to support any suitable OData source. This will significantly broaden the scenarios in which the SAP Fiori MCP server can be applied, giving developers much more flexibility in how they use AI to create and adapt applications.

Try the SAP Fiori MCP server at SAP TechEd 2025

You can experience the SAP Fiori MCP server live at SAP TechEd Berlin. In session CA261 – Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5, we’ll guide you through using AI and MCP to generate applications, adapt them, and extend them with SAPUI5. It’s a hands-on workshop designed to show how these new capabilities come together in practice.

Closing

This release marks the start of a new era in SAP Fiori development, where AI assistants can not only suggest but also execute tasks reliably. With upcoming enhancements like doc search and broader generator support, we’re laying the groundwork for smarter, faster, and more flexible AI-driven development. As an open-source project we also welcome your contributions. We encourage you to report any issues you encounter. Your feedback is invaluable to us.

We can’t wait to see how you experiment with it—and we look forward to meeting you at TechEd!

entry.title: Re: Payment APIs availability in S4 Hana Public Cloud to...
entry.content:
Hello @Hanumath 

Thank you for your question and the screenshot. It was helpful.

There is no universal OData API for directly retrieving files from Manage Payment Media, and S/4HANA Cloud cannot automatically push payment files to SFTP.

SAP offers three standard methods:

16R – SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC)
Comprehensive managed transmission with feedback on status and statements.

2YM – Application Interface to Retrieve Payment Files
Your Integration Suite (CPI) retrieves the payment-medium content from S/4HANA Cloud via an API-based "pull" and then forwards it to the bank or SFTP.

1EG – Bank Integration with File Interface
Manual/semi-manual process: users download the file in Manage Payment Media, and then you send it onward.

If you proceed with Integration Suite (2YM):

  • In S/4HANA Public Cloud, within scope 2YM, set up the Communication System, User, and Arrangement for the Payment Files service.
  • In CPI, create an iFlow that calls the Payment Files interface, fetches the file payload such as PAIN.001, saves it to SFTP, and optionally manages acknowledgements or return files.
  • Note: S/4HANA Public cloud doesn’t initiate the process; CPI must pull the data after the payment run generates the file, which can be seen in Manage Payment Media.

Useful SAP References (SAP official):

  • SAP KBA – 3516767 - Bank Integration for Incoming receipts (2YM) - Payment Message Handling
  • SAP Help Portal – Scope Item 1EG: Bank Integration with File Interface
  • SAP Help Portal – App: Manage Payment Media
  • SAP Help Portal – Payments and Bank Communication in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (overview and option matrix)
  • Bank Integration with SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chum

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Application Studio 2508 installation

entry.title: SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications
entry.content:
Agentic AI application development is fundamentally reshaping the way business applications are designed, developed, and delivered. AI-powered assistants and copilots are rapidly becoming an integral part of the development process, helping teams to boost productivity, reduce errors, and innovate faster than ever.

Meeting Developers Where They Are

SAP is committed to meeting developers where they’re at – that means no matter where or how you code, you have the freedom to choose the environment that best suits your needs and access to the tools that maximize your productivity and impact.

To that end, I’m excited to share that SAP is introducing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to boost development with the following technologies:

  1. Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP)
  2. SAP Fiori Elements 
  3. SAPUI5 

By adopting these new MCP standards, developers can seamlessly extend SAP’s development capabilities into multiple environments, ensuring flexibility and choice. SAP Build now enhances popular IDEs and AI coding assistants such as Cursor, Windsurf, Github Copilot, Cline and Claude Code.

We are also excited to share that the MCP Server for CAP is being released as an open-source project, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. This marks another step in our commitment to openness and community-driven innovation. Learn more about Open Source at SAP.

What is an MCP?

MCP is an emerging open standard that allows AI models and tools to interact in a structured, secure, and consistent way. MCP acts as a universal bridge between an AI coding assistant with an LLM and external tools, data, and workflows — so the model can seamlessly fetch context, take actions, and deliver more accurate, useful results. MCP gives developers the ability to integrate their tools with the broader AI ecosystem while receiving the right assistance, at the right time, without switching contexts.

The Value of SAP MCP Tools

While many AI tools generate code, SAP takes this a step further by ensuring that what’s generated provides a solid foundation for building enterprise-grade applications. The MCP tools delivered by SAP are backed by our technology teams and designed specifically for SAP Business Applications. This means:

  • Best Practices Built-In: Generated code with CAP, UI5 and Fiori elements code already provides you with the right starting point for reaching SAP standards and proven design guidelines.
  • Guided Development: Developers receive recommendations and guardrails tailored to SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
  • Consistency:  SAP’s MCP tools are and will be reused across our tooling portfolio, ensuring consistent developer experience and outcomes wherever you build SAP applications. Whether you’re generating backend services, UIs, or business logic, you can rely on the same quality, structure, and compliance.

Scaling AI Agents with SAP Expertise

One of the most powerful aspects of MCP adoption is the ability to upscale AI agent chat capabilities with deep SAP application development expertise. This means that AI copilots and agents can go beyond generic code suggestions to provide context-aware, SAP-specific guidance. Whether you are working with Vibe Coding tools on the web or coding directly in your IDE of choice, MCP brings value to everyone — from casual and junior developers to senior professionals. It enables you to build enterprise-grade SAP applications with confidence, while seamlessly combining AI-driven assistance with SAP’s trusted frameworks, best practices, and tooling to maximize productivity.

 

Looking Ahead

These are exciting times to be a developer. The combination of AI and open standards like MCP is rewriting the rules of software development. At SAP, we are committed to keeping our developer community at the forefront of innovation. By investing in AI-powered tools and standards, we ensure that you—our developers—have everything you need to build, scale, and innovate with confidence. 🚀

The operation ID repeats in the 2nd line of :61: and in :81:. The first 50 characters of :81: are put into Item Text. However we are unable to extract from there as the ID starts from position 54 and is not available.

Kindest regards,

Victor

entry.title: Re: SAP public cloud restrictions
entry.content:
Hello @SAPuser1996 

The information provided is accurate. It clearly outlines the limitations and offers best practices for handling profit center restrictions in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

The Core Issue

The' Maintain Business Roles app employs an inclusion-based security model. You need to specify which profit centers a user can view, as the system does not support exclusion operators like!. The truncation you noticed occurs because the system does not recognise the input as a valid operator.

The possible Solution

The most effective and well-supported solution is to utilise profit center hierarchies.

Create a Hierarchy Node: In the Manage Global Hierarchies app, create a dedicated node Use for example Z_ALLOWED_PC  to indicate all profit centers a role can access.

Assign Profit Centers: Include all authorized profit centers within this new hierarchical node.

In the Maintain Business Roles SAP Learning app, apply hierarchy restrictions to the profit center field by selecting this hierarchy node.

This method creates a dynamic exclude list effect by establishing an allow list that can be easily adjusted through adding or removing profit centers from the hierarchy node.

This video demonstrates how to assign roles to users in SAP Cloud ALM, a related aspect of role management in the cloud. How to Assign Roles to Users in SAP Cloud ALM

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Creation of PO in a storage location not available fo...
entry.content: Storage location is required only during goods movement and not required during PO creation. Having said that, system will check whether the material is extended to the plant and not the storage location. If you want to enforce a validation for storage location, you can consider custom validation logic via user exits or BAdIs like ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST

entry.title: Re: Issue configuring user lockout after failed login att...
entry.content:
Hi @stefaniaZ ,

There are two issues in your request that needs to be addressed:

  1. The API key you're using is incorrect. Please ensure you're using the correct API key associated with the RBA (Risk-Based Authentication) rule you've configured.

  2. To apply Risk-Based Authentication in server-side implementations, include the  clientContext object in your accounts.login calls. Once this object is passed, the RBA rules will be triggered for the login attempt.

For a complete overview of how this works in server-side setups, please refer to the documentation RBA for Server-Side Implementations
Hope this is useful.

Regards,
Anand Raj

entry.title: Re: How to find an unique (distinct) value from incoming...
entry.content:
In SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI), sometimes you get payloads (like XML or JSON) with duplicate values, and you want to filter out only the unique/distinct ones. There are a few approaches depending on your payload type and requirement:

🔹 1. Using Content Modifier + Groovy Script

If your payload is XML/JSON and you need to extract distinct values, Groovy is the most flexible way.

Example (XML Payload):

<Root>
<Order>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
</Order>
<Order>
<ProductID>102</ProductID>
</Order>
<Order>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
</Order>
</Root>


You want the unique ProductID values → 101, 102.

Groovy Script Example:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.xml.*

Message processData(Message message) {
def body = message.getBody(String)
def xml = new XmlSlurper().parseText(body)

// Collect distinct ProductIDs
def uniqueProducts = xml.Order.ProductID*.text().unique()

// Convert back to XML or String
def result = "<UniqueProducts>" + uniqueProducts.collect { "<ProductID>${it}</ProductID>" }.join('') + "</UniqueProducts>"

message.setBody(result)
return message
}


Output:

<UniqueProducts>
<ProductID>101</ProductID>
<ProductID>102</ProductID>
</UniqueProducts>

🔹 2. Using Message Mapping with UDF

If you’re using message mapping, you can write a User-Defined Function (UDF) in Java to eliminate duplicates.

Example UDF:

import java.util.HashSet;

public void removeDuplicates(String[] input, ResultList result) {
HashSet<String> uniqueSet = new HashSet<>();
for(String val : input) {
if(uniqueSet.add(val)) {
result.addValue(val);
}
}
}


You can then map this UDF to your target node to ensure only distinct values are passed.

🔹 3. Using JSON to XML Converter + Script

If the incoming payload is JSON, convert it to XML using the JSON to XML Converter step, then use the Groovy method above to filter duplicates.

🔹 4. Using Aggregator Pattern (if needed)

In some scenarios, you may receive multiple messages with repeated values. You can use the Aggregator step in SAP CPI to collect values and then apply distinct logic via script.

✅ Best Approach:

For XML payload → Groovy with XmlSlurper or message mapping UDF.

For JSON payload → Convert to XML, then apply script.

For real-time filtering → Script is the most flexible and powerful option.

entry.title: Don't Let Storage Limits Cloud Your Vision How to Keep SAP Signavio Process Insights Working for You
entry.content:
At some point, every growing team hits a wall.

Reports slow down, dashboards need to be exported manually, and storage warnings pop up more often. This is not a system failure; it's a sign that you're doing something right.

If you're experiencing all this in your use of SAP Signavio Process Insights, it's because you've built something successful enough that it’s outgrowing its limits. Yet, when you hit those storage limits, the clarity that once guided your decisions starts to dim, just when you need it most. 

The good news is that you can scale your business process management capabilities without starting over.

 

When Growth Creates Friction

SAP Signavio Process Insights was built to light up your business process landscape. As your organization evolves, that spotlight needs room to expand. That's where record-based entitlements come in.

 Instead of managing storage thresholds, our new model gives you the flexibility to focus on insights, not capacity. There is no commercial friction, no technical rework, and just uninterrupted visibility into what's working, what's lagging, and where to go next.

 

Are You at a Turning Point?

You might be ready to move to a record-based model if:

  • You're above 90% storage capacity
  • You're manually exporting reports to stay under the limit
  • You're planning to scale Process Insights across more teams or processes

If any of these situations sound familiar, now's the moment to future-proof your setup and maintain momentum without delays.

 

Keep the Light On — and the Insights Flowing

We've put together a short, practical guide to help you make the shift with confidence: 

👉Download the guide

 

What About You?

Have you faced this challenge in your organization? Are you already working with record-based entitlements or navigating that shift now?

Share your experience in the comments below or start a thread in the SAP Signavio Community. Let's learn from each other and build momentum together.

entry.title: Re: Print 8D Report from Q2 Quality Notification
entry.content:
How you have entered the values? While =immediate Tasks and Activities are typically entered at the header level, Corrective Tasks, Causes, and Comments are entered at the item level. If these are entered in a wrong place, then, system wont fetch to report.

Have you maintained the sort sequences and codes ? SAP uses sort sequences and codes to structure the 8D report and if you have maintained in Notification Type (Q2), then the report will not show the desired values.

Also, it seems, Function Module QM06_FM_TASK_REQUEST_8DREPORT to be activated in the Action Box configuration for Q2 notifications as per SAP note 1073905

"routing": {

      "routes": [],
      "targets": {}
    }

and the navigation is defined in section sap.ui.generic.app (you can see it in screenshot of Manifest V2).

In Manfest V4 the navgation is defined with Routing (see screenshot Manifest V4) and there is no Section sap.ui.generic.app.

entry.title: Re: Getting error while using this ODATA API to create bi...
entry.content:
Hi @anijaambika,
 
The error "Billing of BDR 100000314 NOT SUPPORTED BECAUSE ITS SD DOCUMENT CATEGORY IS PBRQ" means that the Billing Document Request (BDR) you are trying to bill has an SD Document Category PBRQ, which is not supported for billing with the CreateFromSDDocument API. 

Why this happens: 

  • The API expects the input document to be of a billable SD Document category (like sales orders, contracts). 
  • PBRQ stands for a Billing Request document category, which is a preliminary request, not directly billable. 

What to do: 

  • You cannot create a billing document directly from a BDR with category PBRQ. 
  • You need to first process or convert the Billing Document Request into a billable SD document (such as an order or contract) supported by the billing process. 
  • Then use that SD document number in the API call. 
     

Summary: 

Billing from BDR with category PBRQ is not supported. Use a billable SD document instead. 

If you need help with converting BDR to a billable document, please check your business process or contact your SAP consultant. 

Thanks and best regards,
Anushka

entry.title: Re: Reference information in MT940 tag :61:
entry.content:
Hello @Vittorio1 

Thank you for your question.

Based on the issue you face from MT940 files into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, specifically regarding the scenario you highlighted with parsing references from tags :61: and :86:, here are a few facts.

Your current issue:

  • Your parser for the :61: tag stops reading at the // delimiter. This means that, in the example, NONREF is extracted and anything after // (specifically the 103814) is ignored by standard rules.
  • Separately, in the :86: tag, the reference (e.g., MX-103814-TRE100180) appears after position 50. The SAP delivered reprocessing rules only evaluate the first 50 characters in this tag, so references appearing deeper in the string are not mapped.

Here are some standard Tools to consider:

  • You can use the Manage Bank Statement Reprocessing Rules app to build mappings if the reference always appears within a predictable substring in tag :61: or in the first 50 chars of tag :86:.
  • For this scenario, since the reference appears after // in :61: or deep into :86:, the standard rules are not sufficient.

SAP Public Cloud Extensibility:

  • The official way recommended by SAP for complex parsing or mapping needs is to use in-app extensibility, specifically the Custom Logic app for the Bank Statement Item Processing business context.
  • This lets you create a BAdI, an Enhancement Implementation which allows you to:
    • Parse the tag :61: string after the // delimiter and extract 103814 or any similar reference.
    • Parse tag :86: and search for references regardless of character position, thus circumventing the 50-character limitation.
    • Assign the extracted reference dynamically to a field such as Assignment for use in matching and reconciliation.

Below are some recommendations you should consider:

  • If the reference position is always fixed and within the supported range of first 50 chars, reprocessing rules can map the value.
  • For cases like this where the reference appears deeper or in multiple places, you can proceed with developing a Custom Logic enhancement.
  • The enhancement should scan :61: and :86: for known patterns, extract the operation reference, and place it in ZUONR for subsequent SAP processing.

Consider the references below for further details.

    • Reprocessing Bank Statement Items (Public Cloud)
    • Extensibility: Bank Statement Processing (Public Cloud)
  • For business context: use “FI_BANK_STATEMENT_ITEM” and BAdI “Enhance Processing of Bank Statement Items.”

To summarise, the best route in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a Custom Logic enhancement for bank statement processing, to handle dynamic parsing and populate the correct reference fields for reconciliation. Please let me know if you need technical details or example code for this enhancement.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Standard BADI Implementation got deleted
entry.content: Run the report BADI_RSANALYZE via se38. This report checks and regenerates a specific BAdI implementation.

entry.title: Multiple Delta Accrual on the Same Date
entry.content:
We have a condition contract that has a validity of 1 Jan 2025 to 30 June 2025. A delta accrual was executed on the 30th June 2025 and posted correctly.

 However, we have discovered that there are some billing documents that had not been posted and these documents have a billing date of 30 June 2025. Since we had executed the delta accrual for this date we can’t run another delta accrual for the same date.

 My question is what is the process to get the “outstanding” billing documents included in the accrual?

entry.title: 🟢 Custom code development and transformation for Clean Core in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
In this session you will learn the enhanced guidelines for ABAP custom code development and governance for clean core supported by the new ABAP Test Cockpit checks. In addition, we provide the overview about the new Gen AI assistance in custom code management tools.

Speakers : Olga Dolinskaja and Thomas Fiedler

entry.title: Sync the rating from the goal to the performance form
entry.content:
Hello, 

we have a performance form with autosync from goal plan. 

In the goal plan we have set custom calculation for rating field as shown below: 

<calculator id="RatingRule1"><![CDATA[tipeobj=="binario" && migliora_se=="aumenta" && actual_achievement>=tgt]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingCalculation1"><![CDATA[100]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingRule2"><![CDATA[tipeobj=="binario" && migliora_se=="diminuisce" && actual_achievement<=tgt]]></calculator>

  <calculator id="RatingCalculation2"><![CDATA[100]]></calculator>

<auto-population field="rating" mode="auto" calc-type="col">

    <rule>

     <rule-condition calculator-id= "RatingRule1"/>

     <calculated-result calculator-id= "RatingCalculation1"/>

    </rule>

    <rule>

     <rule-condition calculator-id= "RatingRule2"/>

     <calculated-result calculator-id= "RatingCalculation2"/>

    </rule>

ecc...

All the goal information added from the Goal module is synced and the rating is visible on the Performance form. However, the rating on the Performance form is not populated:

 

Could you please help me to undestand why this happening?

Thank you

Regards

 

SAP SuccessFactors Performance & Goals

In MDGIMG you can check or uncheck if to Highlight Changes (HC) or not:

this is what we have here:
